publicationStmt.p: Transcription of the Bodleian Library "Register C" (Library Records c.854) with added provenance and title data. This document is part of a MA thesis at Humboldt Universität zu Berlin (MA Library and Information Science)

sourceDesc.p: Bodleian Library Record c.854, known as Register C, is an account book of the Bodleian Library for the years 1720-1767. It records, in various hands, expenses, books bought, donated and given to the library as well as the moving of books to other shelves.

docTitle.titlePart:
The STATE of the Bodleian Library
for the Year MDCCXX:

list.item: I. Of duplicates sold or exchang'd. pag.4

row.cell:
Duplicates sold out of the Bodleian Library
between the ninth of Nov.r 1719 & the eighth of Nov.r 1720
July 21. Dr. Prideaux's Connexion of the History of the Old and new Testament, 1st. vol. 8°.
The Sum for which the Library-Keeper is accountable
The Summ of Bills for Books sign'd by J.B. Joseph Bowles
Dr. Keil's, for le Brun's Voyages
Books pd. for by Mr. Vice-Chancellor in pag. 7

Money laid out for the use of the Bodleian Libray
from the ninth of Novr. 1719. to the eighth of Novr. 1720.
Subscribed to Mr. Jebb for his Edition of Aristides
To the Man who brought up Dr. Hudson's Picture
To the Sweeper for Extraordinary work

For Letter Charges &c. in procuring from Mr. Eccard,
Library Keeper at Han̄over, part of Junius's Ms.
Glossary, which had been formerly stoln by a Dane.

To Dr. Bilstone (by Order of the curators) in part for
transcribing the Curating Book belonging to the
Professor of Divinity

To H. Osbaldeston (Butler of S.M. Hall) the money allow'd
by the Curators to Dr. Swallow, deceas'd for his Extra-
ordinary pains in the Library, by order of Dr. Hudson
Subscribed for Mr. Hearne's Textus Roffensis
To Mr. Wheatly for his Book on the Common Prayer, fol.

Subscribed for Mr. Leslie's Works to Mr. Taylor of
University College

To the men who brought the Pictures from the Ld.
Bp̄. of Durham

To the Sweeper for Extraordinary Work in cleaning
the Books above-stairs & in the Archives, at two several times
To Ben. Cole for the large New Map of England
To Mr. Hearne for the Second Paymt. towards Textus Roffensis
Subscribed for Mr. Hearne's Rob. of Avesbury.

For Charges in receiving Books &c. given by several
Benefactors.
For Middleton’s State of Trinity College in Cambrige

For three Books bought of Norrellius (a Swede) recommended
by the Ld. Bp̄. of London, viz 1°. Phosphorus Orthodoxæ fidei
2°. Σχεδιασμα de avibus, 3°. Xylobalsamum artificiale
For Roper's Life of Sr. Tho. More, &c. by Mr. Hearne
For Chevallonius's Edition of Quintilian 8o. Par. 1527
For bringing Q. Catharine's Picture from London
For two Parcels from the Company of Stationers
For Mr. Mitchels' Books, as p Bill
Remains in hand due to ballance
Jac. Meyeri Annales rerū Flandr. Ant. 1561.

Jos Ripamontii rerum Hispanarum
libri octo. fol.

Bernard. de S. Antonio Epitome
redemptionū Captivorum a FF.
S. Trinitatis. Ulissip. 1623. 4°.

Jo. Maccovius redivivus, opera
Nic. Arnoldi. Franck. 1654. 4°.

Crackanthorp defensio Eccl. Angl.

Greg. a S. Vincentio Curvilineorum
Contemplatio. Lugd. 1654.4o.

C. Sagittarii Historia Passionis D. N.
Jesu Xti. Jenae 1671. 4°.

Bp. Nicholson's Historical Library
in three parts. Lond. 1714. fol.

NB. The above mention'd Books
[in this 7th. page] were bespoke of
Stephen Fletcher, Bookseller, by Doctor
Hudson, sometime before the last vi‐
sitation, but not paid for, nor placed
in the Library till now. JB Joseph Bowles .

Given afterwards by
the Bishop, as appears
in the next year's
Account.
[Mr. Hoadley] Bp̄. of Bangor's Answer to Dr. Hare. Lond. 1720.

Mabillonii Supplementum in lib. de
re diplomatica Par. 1704. fol.

The Books that follow next in
this page were bought in Dr.
Hudson's Time, but not placed
in the Library till now.
